NewsLines.HeadLine: NY Man Randomly Stabs 8-Year Old Boy at New York Dave and Busters

ContentItem.DataContent: 23-year old Evan Sachs pleaded not guilty Saturday on charges of second degree attempted murder, assault and possession of a dangerous weapon after repeatedly stabbing an 8 year old boy in the back with a hunting knife.

NewsLines.HeadLine: NY Man Randomly Stabs 8-Year Old Boy at New York Dave and Busters

ContentItem.DataContent: 23-year old Evan Sachs pleaded not guilty Saturday on charges of second degree attempted murder, assault and possession of a dangerous weapon after repeatedly stabbing an 8 year old boy in the back with a hunting knife.

NewsLines.HeadLine: Orlando Girl Accused Of Poisoning Adoptive Family

ContentItem.DataContent:
Deputies in Orlando, Fla. arrested a 13-year-old girl after her adoptive mother tested positive for arsenic in her blood.
Investigators accuse the girl of lacing her family's food with insecticide, dog feces and soapy water.

NewsLines.HeadLine: Orlando Girl Accused Of Poisoning Adoptive Family

ContentItem.DataContent: Deputies in Orlando, Fla. arrested a 13-year-old girl after her adoptive mother tested positive for arsenic in her blood.

NewsLines.HeadLine: France Raises Retirement Age To Cut Pension Costs

ContentItem.DataContent: Defying trade union threats, the French Senate on Friday approved an increase in the country's retirement age from 60 to 62 in an effort to reduce pension costs.

NewsLines.HeadLine: France Raises Retirement Age To Cut Pension Costs
Syria, Iran Object To $2.75 Billion U.S.-Israel Defense Deal

ContentItem.DataContent:
Just a day after the United States signed a $2.75 billion deal to sell 20 F-35 fighter jets to Israel, Syria opposed the move and said that the defense deal will threaten security in the region.
Under the deal, Israel will get 20 fifth-generation F-35 stealth jets, which cannot be detected by radar, and the first jet will be delivered between 2015 and 2017.

NewsLines.HeadLine: Syria, Iran Object To $2.75 Billion U.S.-Israel Defense Deal

ContentItem.DataContent: Just a day after the United States signed a $2.75 billion deal to sell 20 F-35 fighter jets to Israel, Syria opposed the move and said that the defense deal will threaten security in the region.

NewsLines.HeadLine: Al Shabaab: We Will Never Negotiate With Somali Government

ContentItem.DataContent: Somalia's al Shabaab has spurned any negotiations with the Transitional Federal Government of Somalia led by Sharif sheikh Ahmed, according to an al Shabaab official.

NewsLines.HeadLine: Al Shabaab: We Will Never Negotiate With Somali Government
